au.gov.naa.digipres.xena.kernel.normalise
Class NormaliserManager

java.lang.Object
  au.gov.naa.digipres.xena.kernel.normalise.NormaliserManager

public class NormaliserManager
extends java.lang.Object

This class is responsible for managing all things pertaining to normalisers.

It basically does the following broad tasks:

  • Loads Normalisers
  • Loads De-Normalisers
  • Maintains the relationship of types to normalisers / denormalisers
  • Handles the actual normalisation process
  • Handles exporting (Denormalisation)

The binary normaliser and denormaliser are built into this class. Other normalisers are able to be loaded as part of plugins using the loadManager interface methods (load(JarPreferences jp) and complete()). This is usually called by the plugin manager. Otherwise, this class allows normalisers and denormalisers to be retrieved based on their name, class or class name, tags, input type or output type. At this stage, there are a number of Maps which are maintained to facilitate this, however, ultimately this may have to be changed. These changes will be transparent to calling applications. This class also allows normalisers to be 'disabled', although this feature is deprecated and types should be disabled rather than normalisers.

Finally, the normaliser manager is responsible for the actual normalising of XenaInputSource objects, including wrapping, as well as the Denormalising of Xena files to the appropriate format they are required to be exported to.

See Also:
AbstractNormaliser, AbstractDeNormaliser, PluginManager

wrapEmbeddedNormaliser

public AbstractMetaDataWrapper wrapEmbeddedNormaliser(AbstractNormaliser normaliser,
                                                      XenaInputSource xis,
                                                      org.xml.sax.ContentHandler primaryHandler)
                                               throws org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                                      XenaException
Return a XMLFilter with suitable chaining of events so that the output file will be wrapped with appropriate meta-data. This is an embedded normaliser, thus we need to ensure that start and end document events are not passed on to the primary content handler.

Parameters:
normaliser - normaliser to be used
xis - source of data
mesgLevel - level of embedding within the output Xena file
Returns:
XMLFilter which will handle the XML stream

org.xml.sax.SAXException

parse

public void parse(AbstractNormaliser normaliser,
                  org.xml.sax.InputSource xis,
                  AbstractMetaDataWrapper wrapper,
                  NormaliserResults results)
           throws XenaException
Normalise an actual document given a source of data.

This method takes as a parameter a normaliser, an XIS and a wrapper and then calls the normaliser's parse method on the XIS after the wrapper has been added to the normaliser.

Parameters:
normaliser - normaliser to use
xis - source of data
Throws:
XenaException

normalise

public NormaliserResults normalise(XenaInputSource xis,
                                   AbstractNormaliser normaliser,
                                   java.io.File destinationDir,
                                   AbstractFileNamer fileNamer,
                                   AbstractMetaDataWrapper wrapper)
                            throws XenaException,
                                   java.io.IOException
normalise This code is part of the Xena API that should be used for all applications that require Xena functionality (including, arguably, the Xena GUI!) It should be called thusly: NormaliserManager normaliserManager = NormaliserManager.singelton(); normaliserManager.normalise(normaliser, xis, log); It is currently not called from the GUI, and changes wuill not effect the GUI in any way.

Parameters:
normaliser - - normaliser to use
xis - - the input source to use
destinationDir - - destination dir for output files
fileNamer - - fileNamer to use fo generate the output files
wrapper - - wrapper to use to create the tags around the normalised content.
Returns:
NormaliseDataStore - an object containing all the information generated during the normalise process.
Throws:
XenaException
java.io.IOException
org.xml.sax.SAXException

export

public ExportResult export(XenaInputSource xis,
                           java.io.File outDir)
                    throws XenaException,
                           java.io.IOException,
                           org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                           javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
This is the export function for xena. It is called from the Xena object as part of the Xena API. Takes a xenaFile (which is just a regular file!), finds out what normalised it, and tries to denormalise it. It calls the export(XenaInputSource xis, File outDir, boolean overwriteExistingFiles) method with overwrite set to false.

Parameters:
xenaFile -
outDir -
Throws:
java.io.IOException
org.xml.sax.SAXException
XenaException
javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
See Also:
NormaliserManager.export(XenaInputSource xis, File outDir, boolean OverwriteExistingFiles)

export

public ExportResult export(XenaInputSource xis,
                           java.io.File outDir,
                           boolean overwriteExistingFiles)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                           XenaException,
                           javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
Export a Xena file into either it's original format or the format it has been converted to, depending on the normaliser / denormaliser. Some plugins do not allow stuff to be denormalised for some reason.

This method takes a Xena file, looks up the abstract denormaliser

xis -
outDir -
overwriteExistingFiles -
Returns:
Throws:
java.io.IOException
org.xml.sax.SAXException
